metadata.title: CVE-2016-9964 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
redirect() in bottle.py in bottle 0.12.10 doesn't filter a "\r\n" sequence,which leads to a CRLF attack, as demonstrated by aredirect("233\r\nSet-Cookie: name=salt") call.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9964` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-bottle - 0.12.7-1+deb8u1build0.16.04.1
python3-bottle - 0.12.7-1+deb8u1build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-bottle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.12.7-1+deb8u1build0.16.04.1').
